title: Double lease deals for Bledisloe Property Group
text:
Hold and distribute

Rathdrum Properties has leased a 1325sq m industrial property at 44 Boorea Street, Lidcombe, in Sydney's west to wholesaler and distributor Green Forest International.

The three-year deal was struck at a net annual rent of $140 a square metre.

CBRE’s Raj Chaudhary and Cathy Henderson negotiated the deal.

Harrolds sews up space

Luxury fashion retailer Harrolds has signed a 10-year lease over a 940sq m office-warehouse in South Melbourne to improve distribution to its Melbourne, Sydney and Gold Coast stores.

CBRE’s Jake George, Guy Naselli and Ben Quennell negotiated the off-market lease of 45 Brady Street at an annual rent of $160,000 for a private landlord.

Timber supplier moves

Advertisement

TLB Timber has relocated to a newly leased 7927sq m office-warehouse in Geebung, Brisbane.

The property is a concrete tilt-panel building with hardstand offering future expansion possibilities.

JLL's Nick Bandiera and Gibson Leembruggen closed the deal at 140-160 Robinson Road.

Action stations

Action Smart Group has taken a three-month lease over a 4300sq m office-warehouse at 15 Huntingwood Drive in Sydney's Huntingwood to accommodate a spike in business.

The property has roller doors and recessed docks, separate access for cars and trucks and awnings for all-weather loading.

CBRE’s Matthew Alessi, John Micallef, Moshe Greengarten and Cameron Grier were responsible.

Gym bulks up

Advertisement

Shredded Health & Performance has expanded its gym at a newly leased larger property at 401 Scarborough Beach Road, Innaloo, in Western Australia.

The 958sq m showroom-retail space was leased at a net annual rent of $219,900 over six years.

Vend Property's Jeff Klopper acted for private landlord Broadview Enterprises.

Sunny deal

Solar energy equipment supplier Raystech has agreed terms on a 2276sq m office-warehouse at 22 Ashover Road, Rocklea, in Queensland to accommodate an expansion.

The property has container set-down and multiple roller-door access, and a large all-weather awning. It is fully fenced.

Colliers International's David Brisk negotiated the eight-year lease with options at a net annual rent of $105 a square metre.

New craft beer bar

Advertisement

Craft beer business Ze Pickle will open a new bar at a retail property previously leased to KFC in Noosa Heads, Queensland.

The 10-year lease over the 506sq m site at 5 Sunshine Beach Road was handled by Ray White's Paul Butler and Louisa Blennerhassett.

Shredded Health & Performance has expanded its gym at a newly leased larger property at 401 Scarborough Beach Road, Innaloo, in Western Australia.

7-Eleven no more

Dulux Group will lease the former 7-Eleven store at 697-699 High Street in Melbourne's Prahran for seven years with options at a net annual rent of $90,000.

The 163sq m open-plan showroom has seven car spaces.

Teska Carson’s Luke Bisset and Jack Kelliher represented a private investor.

Submissions to stan@afr.com
description: Luxury fashion retailer Harrolds has also signed a 10-year lease over a 940sq m office-warehouse in South Melbourne.
